content:
# The inspection reveals that the Stone Furnace has produced 9 iron plates but is currently in a "NO_INGREDIENTS" state. 
# This indicates that it has finished smelting the available iron ore but does not have any more iron ore to process.

# I also see that the furnace still has 4 coal left, which means it has sufficient fuel for further operations if I can gather more iron ore.

# To continue production, I will need to gather more iron ore. I will locate the nearest iron ore patch and harvest additional resources.

resource_position = nearest(Resource.IronOre)  # Find the nearest iron ore resource patch.
move_to(resource_position)  # Move to the closest iron ore patch.
harvest_resource(resource_position, quantity=10)  # Harvest 10 iron ore from the patch.
print(f"Inventory changed to {inspect_inventory()}")  # Check inventory after harvesting iron ore.

# After gathering more iron ore, I will insert it back into the Stone Furnace to continue smelting. 
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=10)  # Insert 10 iron ore into the furnace.
print(f"Inserted iron ore into the furnace. Inventory now: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Check inventory after inserting iron ore.

# Finally, I will monitor the furnace again to ensure it is processing correctly. 
furnace_status = get_entities({Prototype.StoneFurnace})  # Check the status of the Stone Furnace
print(f"Furnace Status: {furnace_status}")  # Print the current status of the furnace.
